text:
Coenties Slip, east from but not including Pearl, to and including South Streets, showing the South Ferry division of the Second and Third Aves. Elevated Line winding its course from Pearl (left foreground) down Front Street (right center) to the Battery. Also seen is Jeanette Park, a quadrilaterally shaped area which divides Coenties Slip in two parts. Coenties Slip is shaped in the form of an isosceles triangle, with Pearl Street as its vertex and South Street as its base. In the background appears the East River and the Brooklyn shore, across it. Pier 7 is visible on the left.

About 1885.
title: Manhattan: Coenties Slip - Pearl Street

text:
Pearl Street, east side, north from but not including Coenties Slip, to and including Hanover Square. The view also shows the Second and Third Ave., Elevated overhead and obstructing the penetration of the Sun to the street level, with No. 60 Wall Street, in the background. (Pearl Street, is arbitrarily set to run north and south when north of Coenties Slip).

April 17, 1934.
Views 1-2.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Pearl Street - Coenties Slip
